labels.addWalletsDescription: Add as many wallets as you like to the DAO. These are authorized to create proposals, request transactions or suggest changes to the DAO settings from the time of initial creation.
labels.removeWalletsDescription: Remove existing wallets from the authorised list of this particular DAO.
labels.resourcesHelptext: Link to external resources, such as documents, forum links, chats or similar.
labels.label: Name / Description
labels.membership: Who is eligible to participate in your DAO?
labels.communityToken: Does your community have a token?
labels.noResultsSubtitle: Try to modify your search to find the corresponding wallets.

whitelistWallets.addWalletsSubtitle: Add a wallet to your DAO

labels.author: Author

emptyState.title: Create your very first proposal now
emptyState.subtitleLine1: By creating a proposal, your community can vote and participate in this DAO.
emptyState.completeDescription: By creating a proposal, your community can vote and participate in this DAO. Learn more in our Proposal Guide

executionCard.title: Execution
executionCard.description: These smart actions are executed when the proposal reaches sufficient support.

status.succeeded: Proposal has passed and is ready to be executed

infos.voteDuration: The minimum duration of 5 days is defined by DAO Governance Settings
infos.newVotingTypes: New voting types will be released soon

errors.amountWithInvalidToken: Cannot validate amount with invalid token address
errors.durationTooShort: Duration must be at least 5 days
errors.endPast: End date must be more then 5 days from the start
errors.exceedsFractionalParts: The number of decimals in the amount must not exceed the number of decimals of the token({{decimals}})
errors.includeExactAmount: The token doesn't contain decimals. Please enter the exact amount
errors.invalidImageType: Invalid file type. Please provide either a SVG, JPG, PNG or GIF
errors.imageDimensions: Please provide a squared image with size between {{minDimension}}px and {{maxDimension}}px on each side
errors.imageTooLarge: Please provide an image of max {{maxFileSize}}MB in size
errors.lteZero: The amount must be greater than zero
errors.ltAmount: The amount must be less than {{amount}}
errors.notERC20Token: Token address is not ERC20 compliant
errors.percentage: Percentage amount should be between 0 and 100
errors.totalSupplyZero: Total token supply can not be 0
errors.startPast: Process must not start in the past
errors.ensUnsupported: Network does not support ens name

alert.durationAlert: We recommend a minimum duration of 1 day if it does not have to be a quick financial decision.

wrongNetwork.title: Wrong Network
wrongNetwork.description: The action can’t be executed because you are in the wrong network. Change to the <1>{{network}}</1> on your wallet and try again.

loginRequired.title: Wallet connection
loginRequired.description: To continue with this action, a wallet must be connected.

alert.tokenBasedMembers: The DAO members listed here have interacted with the DAO at least once

warnings.amountGtDaoToken: Withdraw amount is greater than the current token balance

TransferModal.item1Subtitle: Add assets to the DAO treasury
TransferModal.item2Subtitle: Propose to withdraw assets from the DAO treasury

TokenModal.tokenNotAvailableSubtitle: Check your wallet, update the tokens or add a custom token to transfer
TokenModal.tokenNotAvailableSubtitleDao: Update the tokens or add a custom token to transfer.

TransactionModal.approveSubtitle: To sign your first transaction, you must approve Aragon App to make a transaction with your token.

AddActionModal.title: Add Action
AddActionModal.addAddressesSubtitle: Propose to add addresses to this DAO
AddActionModal.removeAddressesSubtitle: Propose to remove addresses from this DAO
AddActionModal.withdrawAssetsSubtitle: Propose to withdraw assets from the DAO treasury
AddActionModal.withdrawAssetsActionSubtitle: Withdraw assets from the DAO treasury
AddActionModal.externalContractSubtitle: Interact with any contract on the blockchain and access any functionality

newDeposit.configureDepositSubtitle: Enter the desired token and its number for transmission. Furthermore, a reception address is necessary.
newDeposit.reviewTransferSubtitle: Check your details and make sure everything is correct. After confirmation, no more changes can be made and your token will be transferred.
newDeposit.toSubtitle: The recipient of the tokens is the DAO in which you are currently operating.
newDeposit.tokenSubtitle: Select Token to deposit in DAO
newDeposit.contractAddressSubtitle: You have selected a custom token. Enter the contract address of this token to interact with it.
newDeposit.referenceSubtitle: Add a reference copy to identify this transaction later on

configureWithdraw.title: Configure Withdraw
configureWithdraw.subtitle: Enter the desired token and its number for transmission. Furthermore, a reception address is necessary.
configureWithdraw.tokenSubtitle: Select token you'd like to withdraw

setupVoting.title: Setup Voting
setupVoting.description: For a withdraw, a vote is necessary so that the majority can determine whether your proposal is legitimate. For this, you need this configuration.

yesNoLabel.title: Yes, Abstain & No
yesNoLabel.helptext: Let users vote for or against.

setupVoting.endDescription: Define how long the voting should last in days or exact date and time.

defineProposal.heading: Define Proposal
defineProposal.description: A proposal is necessary so that the community understands why you want to execute this withdraw. Fill in the necessary fields and be as detailed but as concise as possible.
defineProposal.title: Title
defineProposal.titleHelptext: Define a custom title if needed
defineProposal.summaryHelptext: Describe this proposal in 2-3 short sentences as a summary. This information will be presented in the sharing and overview.

reviewProposal.heading: Review Proposal
reviewProposal.description: A proposal is necessary so that the community understands why you want to execute this withdraw. Fill in the necessary fields and be as detailed but as concise as possible.

overview.title: Get started with your DAO
overview.description: Start simple and learn as a team. You and your community can always decide how to evolve your DAO as you go.

step1.label: Step 1
step1.title: Choose Blockchain
step1.description: Your DAO should live on the blockchain where you expect most of your transactions to happen - where will you trade coins, make payments, etc.  If you already have a token, use the same chain.  The chain cannot be changed later, though you can create a new DAO if you want to. For more details on chains, layer 1 and layer 2, etc see our
step1.shortDescription: Decide which blockchain the DAO should be at home on.

step2.label: Step 2
step2.title: Describe your DAO
step2.description: Name and define your DAO so people know they have come to the right place. These choices can be changed by a proposal and vote in the DAO.
step2.shortDescription: Let people find your DAO!  Name your DAO, give it a mission, link to sites and communities.
step2.nameSubtitle: This name shows on lists, best if under 128 characters.
step2.logoSubtitle: This is the Logo which represents your DAO. We support SVG, JPG, PNG or GIFs with max 3MB in size and must have 1:1 ratio. We suggest dimension of 1024x1024px.
step2.descriptionSubtitle: What is your DAO's mission or goal?  This description appears on detail pages where your DAO is listed publicly.
step2.linksSubtitle: Link out to websites, community forums, repositories or documents. Point people to where your mission and proposal discussions live.

step3.label: Step 3
step3.title: Define your Community
step3.description: This section defines who is allowed to create proposals in your DAO and vote on them. You can identify specific people based on their wallet addresses or let people cast a vote for each of your tokens they hold. If you have a token already, use that. Otherwise you can create a new token here.
step3.shortDescription: Who is eligible to participate in the DAO? Create a token if needed.
step3.authorisedWalletsSubtitle: Add as many addresses as you like to the DAO. These are authorised to create proposals, transactions or suggest changes to the DAO settings after its creation. Upload a CSV with this template if you want.
step3.warningSubtitle: If you want to add addresses after creating your DAO, you will need to create a proposal to be voted by the members.
step3.newTokenSubtitle: No, I would like to create a token.
step3.existingTokenSubtitle: Yes, we already have a token.
step3.tokenMembershipSubtitle: All those who have a token are entitled to participate. 1 token equals 1 vote.
step3.walletMemberShipSubtitle: Only authorised wallets are entitled to particpiate. 1 Wallet equals 1 vote.
step3.nameSubtitle: The full name of the token eg. Aragon
step3.symbolSubtitle: The symbol of your token e.g. ANT (good practice is to use 3-4 letters)
step3.addExistingTokenHelptext: Hinterlege einen bestehenden Token, welcher deine Community für die Governance verwendet. To learn more about what it’s important if you use an existing Token, read first the
step3.tokenContractSubtitlePart1: Copy the contract address directly from the
step3.tokenContractSubtitlePart2: This way you can ensure that the address is correct.
step3.distributeTokensHelpertext: Determine who receives how many tokens. Unless otherwise specified, the treasury receives the rest tokens for the future distribution of tokens (these tokens have no voting rights and do not influence the quorum).
step3.distributionWalletAlertText: Your connected wallet got automatically added to the token distribution.
step3.whiteListWalletAlertText: Your connected wallet got automatically added to the list.
step3.createTokenHelptext: Mint a community token on a variable or fixed supply. To learn more about how to mint the token and how to use it, read the

step4.label: Step 4
step4.title: Rules for Deciding
step4.description: These are the rules that set how voting works in your DAO. How many people have to participate? What percent counts as winning? How long may a proposal be open for voting? Learn more about
step4.shortDescription: How are decisions made in the DAO? How long may a proposal be open for voting?
step4.minimumApprovalSubtitle: Support is the percentage of tokens or addresses that are required to vote “Yes” for a proposal to be approved, calculated based on total tokens or addresses that voted.
step4.minimumParticipationSubtitle: Participation is the percentage of the token supply or addresses in the authorized list that vote on a proposal (either yes or no). The minimum is how many have to vote for the result to be valid.
step4.supportSubtitle: Support is the relative percentage of tokens or wallets that are required to vote “Yes” for a proposal to be approved.
step4.durationSubtitle: Duration is the length of time that a proposal will be open for participation. The duration applies to each proposal in the DAO. Proposal creators can extend the time if necessary, but not shorten it!

alerts.minimumParticipationAlert: Rounded up to {{percentage}}% equals {{walletCount}} Wallets have to vote

review.title: Go Live
review.description: Take your DAO public by reviewing the following information and cross-checking the values.
review.daoUpdatesHelpText: These choices can be changed by a proposal and vote in the DAO.
review.acceptContent: You have to accept your proposed content.

configureActions.heading: Configure Actions
configureActions.description: If the response is to execute a transaction, store your desired actions at the corresponding response. These can be simple transactions or any smart contract methods you can find (e.g. Uniswap or similar).
configureActions.yesOptionSubtitle: If the option “yes” wins the voting, perform the following actions.
configureActions.addFirstActionSubtitle: Add your very first optional action if you wish to perform on-chain executions
configureActions.actionsInfo: Based on the voting options setup, it is only possible to add actions to the option "Yes".

mintTokens.methodDescription: Which wallet addresses should get tokens, and how much? Add the wallets you want here, and then choose the distribution. Upload a CSV with <1>this template</1> if you want.
mintTokens.additionalInfo: The total token supply is inclusive of the already distributed tokens of the existing holders.

manageWallets.title: Manage authorised wallets
manageWallets.description: TBD Description, but something like: To add and/or remove new members to this wallet-based DAO …

votingTerminal.title: Voting
votingTerminal.yesHelptext: Your choice will be counted for option yes
votingTerminal.abstainHelptext: Your choice will be counted for option abstain
votingTerminal.noHelptext: Your choice will be counted for option no
votingTerminal.chooseOptionHelptext: To vote, you must select one of the following options. Afterwards, a confirmation with your wallet is necessary. Once the transaction is completed, your vote will be counted and displayed.

status.ineligibleWhitelist: You had to be a member before the proposal was created to be able to vote
status.ineligibleTokenBased: You had to hold {{token}} when proposal was created to be able to vote

emptyState.title: There are no voters yet
emptyState.subtitle: Search for another wallet or ENS address

hero.title: EXPLORE THE DAO WORLD
hero.subtitle1: Welcome to the Aragon Explore Portal.
hero.subtitle2: Take a look to the ecosystem,find inspiration and learn.

emptyStateProposal.title: There are no active proposals
emptyStateProposal.description: You can still check upcoming or past proposals on your DAOs.

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy policy
privacyPolicy.analyticsHelpText: It will allow to collect information of how you use our app.
privacyPolicy.functionalHelpText: Used to store your preferences in the application.
privacyPolicy.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to improve your browsing experience in our application, enabling certain features, and analyzing our application usage. You may choose below to opt-out for some specific behaviors. Know more by reading our

cookiePreferences.title: Cookie Preferences
cookiePreferences.content: In order to use this feature you need to allow the usage of functional cookies so we can store your preferences within our app.

create.title: Create a DAO
create.description: Create your Decentralized Autonomous Organization on open-source infrastructure with governance plugins.

learn.title: Learn about DAO
learn.description: Explore and learn through our “How-to Guides”, DAO Education, Educational Articles and more!

build.title: Build faster
build.description: Build something something on open-source infrastructure with governance plugins.

settings.proposeSettingsSubtitle: Confirm the new settings that will be presented to the community in your proposal.
settings.editSubtitle: To edit the DAO settings, fill the new data and then you have to propose this to the DAO community. If it gets approved, the new settings will get applied.
settings.proposeSettingsInfo: To make changes to the settings of this DAO, a vote must be taken via the community.

emptyTransfers.title: Create Very First Transfer
emptyTransfers.description: Create the first financial transaction for this DAO by by either depositing or withdrawing tokens.
